body.p:
Cincinnati May 13th 1861
Hon Geo. B. Hodge
Dear Sir

I have a fine of fifty dollars Standing against me in Campbell and am not able to pay it I am out of employment and have no means to pay itthe fine. and if I return to Newport I am liable to be imprisoned, I am anxious to live at home and if you will exert your Self in my behalf I shall feel Greatly obliged to you R T Baker, Esq has written to the govenor and I think you can relieve me by Speaking to him please intercede in my favor and

oblige Yours Respectly
John R. Doxon
